document.docAuthor: Dronen, Norman O. & Blend, Charles K.
document.masterDocTitle: Updated keys to the genera in the subfamilies of Cyclocoelidae Stossich, 1902, including a reconsideration of species assignments, species keys and the proposal of a new genus in Szidatitreminae Dronen, 2007

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updated keys to the genera in the subfamilies of Cyclocoelidae Stossich, 1902, including a reconsideration of species assignments, species keys and the proposal of a new genus in Szidatitreminae Dronen, 2007

heading.emphasis:
B . variolaris
Fuhrmann, 1904
— Type and only species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type host.
Snail kite,
Rostrhamus sociabilis (Vieillot)
(Syn.
Resthramus [ sic ] sociabilis
[Vieillot]) ( Accipitriformes : Accipitridae )—
Thatcher ( 1993 )
,
Cole et al . ( 1995 )
,
Forrester & Spalding ( 2003 )
.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 22. Measurements, mοrphοmetric percentages and mοrphοmetric ratiοs fοr species οf Bothrigaster Dοllfus 1948, Spaniometra Kοssack, 1911, Porphyriotrema Duggal & Τοοr, 1986 Οphthalmοphaginae Harrah, 1922) and Szidatitrema Υamaguti, 1971 (Szidatitreminae Drοnen, 2007). Percentages οf bοdy length shοwn in brackets.

tr.th: Pharynx⁄οral sucker ratiο ventral sucker width

subSubSection.paragraph: NP = Nοt present. 1 Estimated frοm figure in οriginal descriptiοn. 2 Measurements frοm Perez vigueras ( 1940 ).

Type locality.
Java, Indonesia , specific locality unknown.

Additional localities. Brazil & Cuba—Thatcher ( 1993 ); Florida, USA—Cole et al . ( 1995 ),
Forrester & Spalding ( 2003 )
.

Remarks. This species was originally described as
Bothriogaster variolaris
Fuhrmann, 1904
from immature specimens parasitizing birds in Java (
Fuhrmann, 1904
); however,
Pérez Vigueras ( 1940 )
provided some additional descriptive information (see below).
Bothriogaster (
Fuhrmann, 1904
)
was preoccupied and
Dollfus ( 1948 )
renamed it Bothrigaster
Dollfus, 1948
.
Kossack ( 1911 )
,
Harrah ( 1922 )
,
Witenberg ( 1923 )
and
Yamaguti ( 1958
, 1971 ) considered Bothrigaster (Syn.
Bothriogaster
) and Spaniometra to be distinct genera and retained this species in Bothrigaster with
Bothrigaster variolaris
(
Fuhrmann, 1904
) as the type species.
Joyeux & Baer ( 1927 )
transferred this species to Spaniometra and
Bashkirova ( 1950 )
also considered it to be a species of Spaniometra . This species has a postesticular ovary that forms a straight line with the tandem testes (Ophthalmophaginae), a postpharyngeal genital pore and the vitelline fields are not confluent posteriorly, placing it in Bothrigaster . Pérez Vigueres ( 1940 ) redescribed this species from adult specimens parasitizing the snail kite in South America . The host data base of the Natural History Museum, London lists
Bothrigaster variolaris
as an unverified name. Rudimentary ventral sucker present; oral sucker absent—Fuhrmann ( 1904 );
Pérez Vigueras ( 1940 )
;
Bashkirova ( 1950 )
;
Yamaguti ( 1971 )
.
